      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        XXX If the socket and the superclass disagree about whether the socket is closed, this implementation closes it at both levels. The alternative would seem to be to force the superclass to agree with the socket, marking it open if the socket is open. This leads to complexities, in that you must set the state to either BOUND or CONNECTED. The simpler solution is to silently close it.
        Overrides:
        isClosed in class PacketPort
